Key Match Events: Roston Chase pulled off a rescue act at the death as West Indies survived a scare against Papua New Guinea and won by 5 wickets.
Sese Bau top scored for Papua New Guinea with a steady 50 as wickets fell all around him against the West Indies as PNG posted 136/8 in 20 overs.
Akeal Hosein cleaned up Lega Siaka and Romario Shepherd took out Tony Ura early in the innings.
Assad Vala was dismissed by Alzarri Joseph with PNG losing 3 wickets in the powerplay.
Alzarri Joseph ended up with 2 wickets while Andre Russell also picked up 2 wickets.
Rovman Powell won the toss and West Indies opted to bowl first.
West Indies chased down the target of 137 with 5 wickets in hand, finishing at 137/5 in 19 overs.
Pre-Game Insights: Rovman Powell: We are going to bowl first. It is a fresh wicket, we will hope to restrict them and then our batters can chase it down. It is going to be the same Providence wicket and it provides us an opportunity to play good cricket. I am excited and the team is excited to win a home WC, it is something we are looking forward to and hopefully we can deliver. We have two all rounders and three spinners.

Assad Vala: It looks like a good wicket even though there's been rain around for the last two days. We have the right balance at the moment with a lot of all rounders. The preparation has been very good, we have been here for over two weeks and are looking forward to the tournament.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain interrupted play briefly during the West Indies' innings.
West Indies have previously won the T20 World Cup twice, in 2012 and 2016.
